issue.title: [EASY] Add UI option to pass through custom `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` from Swift
issue.body:
EXO supports multiple p2p namespaces to split up clusters. This is usable when building from source by providing the `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` environment variable when running from source, but when using the macOS app this is hardcoded to the application version.

Add an option in the macOS UI to extend this variable with a custom parameter. This will allow splitting machines that can see each other into multiple clusters.

comment.body: will this be okay @JakeHillion

issue.body:
EXO supports multiple p2p namespaces to split up clusters. This is usable when building from source by providing the `EXO_LIBP2P_NAMESPACE` environment variable when running from source, but when using the macOS app this is hardcoded to the application version.

issue.title: fix(openai): cache httpx clients in AzureChatOpenAI

labels.name: integration
labels.description: PR made that is related to a provider partner package integration

labels.name: fix
labels.description: For PRs that implement a fix

issue.body:
## Description

Fixes #32489

[AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) was creating new `httpx.Client` and `httpx.AsyncClient` instances on each instantiation, leading to resource inefficiency. This aligns [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) with the existing behavior in [BaseChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/base.py:487:0-2210:9).

## Changes

1. Import cached httpx client helper functions from [_client_utils.py](cci:7://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:0:0-0:0)
2. Use [_get_default_httpx_client()](cci:1://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:84:0-96:59) and [_get_default_async_httpx_client()](cci:1://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/_client_utils.py:99:0-111:60) when no custom http client is provided
3. Add credential check before client creation (matching [BaseChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/base.py:487:0-2210:9) behavior) - defers credential errors to invocation time

## Performance Impact

- **Before**: 5 [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) instances = 5 sync + 5 async httpx clients created
- **After**: 5 [AzureChatOpenAI](cci:2://file:///Users/black/Documents/repo/langchain/libs/partners/openai/langchain_openai/chat_models/azure.py:33:0-1163:9) instances = 1 sync + 1 async httpx client (cached and reused)

## Testing

- All 9 existing unit tests pass

comment.body: Hi @ccurme @mdrxy can you guys please take a look

issue.title: Embedding models not showing up in "My Models" until an LLM is downloaded
issue.body: Hi there! I would like to point out an apparently inconsistent behaviour on LM Studio (macOS, v. 0.3.36 build 1). I have downloaded an embedding model (`Qwen/Qwen3-Embedding-4B-GGUF`). Everything's fine, download is fine, the model is currently visible in the `.lmstudio/models` folder but the GUI shows the following: so there is 1 local model (see the bottom of the GUI) but I don't see it in the list. However, if I download a proper language model (say, `mistral-7b-v0.3`) the GUI shows both: Is this intended or is it a bug? Best, Alessio

comment.body: Seems like a valid bug though the filter options dont show up unless you download a large language model this is after downloading an embedding model this is after downloading a large language model

payload.description: iscrape is a powerful Python-based web scraper and dataset generator. It recursively crawls websites (handling redirects and subdomains), extracts content using crawl4ai and modern browser tooling, and distills the raw data into fine-tuning ready datasets (JSONL, Markdown, JSON) using LLM providers like Gemini or OpenAI.

release.name: NoMouse v1.1.0
release.body:
## What's New
- Add independent Grid Mode and Flow Mode toggles
- Fix overlay to appear above menu bar and Dock  
- Clear modifier flags from mouse events for reliable clicks
- Add View Shortcuts button linking to SHORTCUTS.md
- Slim menu bar UI with right-aligned toggles
- Add custom volume icon to DMG
release.short_description_html:
What's New

  • Add independent Grid Mode and Flow Mode toggles
  • Fix overlay to appear above menu bar and Dock
  • Clear modifier flags from mouse events for reliable clicks
  • Add View Shortcuts button linkin‚Ä¶

release.name: v1.0.0
release.body:
# NoMouse v1.0.0

üéâ **First release!** Keyboard-driven mouse control for macOS.

## Features
- **Grid Navigation** ‚Äî Type 2 letters to jump anywhere on screen
- **Precision Mode** ‚Äî Single-letter refinement for pixel-perfect positioning
- **All Mouse Actions** ‚Äî Left, right, middle click + drag
- **Scroll Support** ‚Äî ‚åò + Arrow keys
- **Movement Acceleration** ‚Äî Hold arrow keys to speed up
- **Multi-Monitor** ‚Äî Works across all displays
- **Menu Bar App** ‚Äî Minimal footprint, no Dock icon

## Requirements
- macOS 13.0 (Ventura) or later
- Accessibility + Input Monitoring permissions

## Installation
1. Download `NoMouse.dmg`
2. Drag to Applications
3. Grant permissions when prompted
4. Press **‚åÉ Space** to activate

## Keyboard Shortcuts
| Key | Action |
|-----|--------|
| ‚åÉ Space | Activate |
| A-Z + A-Z | Jump to cell |
| Return | Click |
| ‚áß Return | Right-click |
| Arrow keys | Move cursor |
| ‚åò + Arrows | Scroll |
| D | Toggle drag |
| Escape | Exit |
release.short_description_html:
NoMouse v1.0.0

üéâ First release! Keyboard-driven mouse control for macOS.

Features

  • Grid Navigation ‚Äî Type 2 letters to jump anywhere on screen
  • Precision Mode ‚Äî Single-letter refinement for pixel-pe‚Ä¶

payload.description: NoMouse lets you control your Mac cursor entirely with your keyboard. Jump anywhere on screen by typing two letters, or use arrow keys for precise movement.

It serves as a "digital garden" to share thoughts and learnings, while offering engaging elements like a command-line   interface (CLI) for navigation and interaction (Commander), a retro boot screen

issue.title: /compact doesn't correctly optimize the context (v0.63.0)

labels.name: context
labels.description: Issues related to context management (including compaction)

issue.body:
### What version of Codex is running?

codex-cli 0.63.0

### What subscription do you have?

Business

### Which model were you using?

gpt-5.1-codex-max xhigh

### What platform is your computer?

Darwin 25.1.0 arm64 arm

### What issue are you seeing?

I was at 70% usage of my context window and wanted to optimize it using the /compact command to free up some space. However, instead of summarizing the context window, the usage shot up to 100% (328K used / 272K).

### What steps can reproduce the bug?

Uploaded thread: 019ab0b6-de79-77d2-99d3-f3c6a8f7249a

### What is the expected behavior?

ideally the /compact should optimize the context window and free up some space 

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: Yes, the issue is related to token count reporting and not /compact. Usually, when we reach 100% context usage, we receive an error message prompting us to open a /new conversation. However, in this case, we can proceed further, and after sending another message, the usage percentage changes (increases).
